definition.name: NXspm_phase_lock_loop
definition.doc:
A base class definition for a phase-locked loop (PLL) used in AFM experiments.
The PLL maintains a fixed phase relationship between the cantilever oscillation and the reference drive signal. It dynamically adjusts the excitation frequency to track changes in the cantilever's resonance frequency due to tip–sample interactions.

group.name: hardware
group.doc: Manufacturer and model of the PLL hardware or controller.

field.name: reference_frequency
field.doc: Nominal frequency the PLL is locked to when no tip–sample interaction is present.

field.name: frequency_shift
field.doc: Measured shift in oscillation frequency (Δf) relative to the reference frequency.

field.name: reference_phase
field.doc: Target phase between the cantilever oscillation and the drive signal that the PLL attempts to maintain.

field.name: phase_error
field.doc: Measured deviation from the target phase (reference phase).

field.name: drive_amplitude
field.doc: Excitation amplitude applied to the cantilever by the PLL.

field.name: amplitude_setpoint
field.doc: Target oscillation amplitude for the cantilever.

field.name: amplitude_control_status
field.doc: Indicates whether an amplitude control loop is active.

field.name: loop_bandwidth
field.doc: Bandwidth of the PLL loop filter, determining the tracking speed.

field.name: loop_gain
field.doc: Gain setting for the PLL control loop.

field.name: lock_status
field.doc: Indicates whether the PLL is currently locked to the cantilever signal.

field.name: quality_factor
field.doc: Measured quality factor (Q) of the cantilever oscillation from PLL analysis.

field.name: drive_signal_type
field.doc: Type of excitation signal used (e.g., voltage, current, piezo).
